While I deeply regret we have come to this, I stand with my colleagues in support of today‚Äôs resolution. We must hold the president accountable for his misconduct ‚Äì it is our Constitutional obligation. No one is above the law. https://mceachin.house.gov/media/press-releases/mceachin-statement-impeachment-inquiry-resolution¬†‚Ä¶

Our constituents deserve to hear the many ways the president has betrayed our country and put our national security at risk for his own gain. With this vote, we are ensuring transparency, effective public hearings, and due process protections for the president or his counsel.

This is a sad and somber day for our country. Today‚Äôs vote is a necessary step to move forward in the ongoing impeachment inquiry and I strongly support all efforts to clarify and outline the process for our constituents.
